course_title: Foundations of Modern Biology II with Laboratory
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 20Waitlist Total: 0 of 6
course_description: Genetic mechanisms in bacteria, viruses, and eukaryotes including transmission of DNA, regulation of gene expression, gene interaction, mutations, and cancer. Emphasizes research questions, techniques, and applications. Four hours of lecture and one three-hour laboratory per week.
prerequisites: (BIOL 141 and BIOL 141L) or (BIOL_OX 141 and BIOL_OX 141L) or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite. Students with AP/IB credit for BIOL 141/BIOL_OX 141 will have to take BIOL 141L or BIOL_OX 141L.
